hook.text: The 401(k) was an obscure tax code loophole. A benefits consultant turned it into a retirement plan.

buildup.text: In 1980, Ted Benna realized section 401(k) could let employees save pre-tax dollars with employer matches.

discovery.text: Companies loved it because it replaced expensive pensions. Employees got tax breaks and matching funds.

twist.text: The shift moved retirement risk from employers to individuals. Not everyone was prepared.

climax.text: Today over 60 million Americans have 401(k) accounts worth collectively over $7 trillion.

punchline.text: A tax loophole became America's retirement plan.

quiz.question: What was the 401(k) originally?
options: An obscure section of the tax code
